repo.description: A collection of libraries and tools that help you build adaptive, accessible, and robust user experiences.

issue.title: Dialog's focus management and work with 3rd party dialogs
issue.body:
### Provide your feedback here.

I've encountered problems while trying to use [tinymce](https://www.npmjs.com/package/@tinymce/tinymce-react) inside Spectrum's Dialog component.

For some background: the tinymce editor allows you to open the source code editor of a rich text, which opens another dialog, in this case on top of the Spectrum Dialog, that the original rich text editor is in. It seems that the textarea that is inside that new dialog cannot be focused on. Some debugging from my side revealed that right after an attempt of focusing on the new dialog on top, Spectrum's Dialog somehow "forces" the focus to get back on itself. That obviously causes issues with the extra dialog's textarea not being editable or focusable.

There doesn't seem to be any exposed property or way to control or disable the focus behavior of the Spectrum's Dialog component. I would like to spark some discussion whether this is something that Spectrum would like to support in the future - to either give users some freedom in how the focus management works, or to find different solutions for handling nested dialogs.

### 🔦 Context

_No response_

### 💻 Code Sample

CodeSandbox presenting the issue [here](https://codesandbox.io/s/spectrum-dialog-tinymce-example-rlvrgk?file=/src/index.js)

### Version

3.29.0

### What browsers are you seeing the problem on?

Chrome

### If other, please specify

_No response_

### What operating system are you using?

macOS 13.5.2

pull_request.title: WIP add steplist componente
pull_request.body:
Closes <!-- Github issue # here -->

## ✅ Pull Request Checklist:

- [ ] Included link to corresponding [React Spectrum GitHub Issue](https://github.com/adobe/react-spectrum/pull/1362).
- [ ] Added/updated unit tests and storybook for this change (for new code or code which already has tests).
- [ ] Filled out test instructions.
- [ ] Updated documentation (if it already exists for this component).
- [ ] Looked at the Accessibility Practices for this feature - [Aria Practices](https://www.w3.org/TR/wai-aria-practices-1.1/)


I took the great work @itaylor did on step list and did some of the changes that were discussed like:
- changed `aria` hooks to fallow same `pattern`, like the rest of the components passing `props` `state` `ref` to get the components `DOM` props
- added `keyboard` delegation for `useStepList` currently it's the same like for `tabs` but i will fallow with `spectrum` design to get the corect `keyboard` navigation behaviour
- added support for `useSelectableCollection` in `useStepList`
- moved `aria-${props}` out of `useStepItem` to `StepItem` to fallow the same pattern with the rest of the components


My Plan:
- revisit `styling` and make sure we are aligned with `UX` 
- address some comments from @snowystinger regarding `flex` 
- add docs
- refactor `stories` and add more examples

Let me know your thoughts

pull_request.title: Support native form validation
pull_request.body:
Supersedes #4640

This implements support for native HTML form validation across all of our form components. It adds the following APIs:

* The `validationBehavior` prop can be set to `"aria"` (the default) or `"native"`. When set to `"native"`, we use the native `required` attribute rather than `aria-required` so that form submission is blocked by the browser. In addition, we track other native validation messages such as `pattern` or `type="email"` and display all validation errors as Spectrum help text rather than the browser's builtin UI.
* The `validate` prop can be set to a function to perform custom validation. This receives the current value of the field and can return an error message (or multiple) if it is invalid. This is displayed immediately (in realtime) if `validationBehavior="aria"`, or after the field value is committed (e.g. blurred) when `validationBehavior="native"`. This is in addition to our existing `isInvalid` and `errorMessage` props which are always displayed in realtime.
* The `errorMessage` prop now accepts a function in addition to a string. The function receives the current validation details for the field and returns the validation error to display. This allows customizing native validation messages provided by the browser.
* The `Form` component accepts a `validationErrors` prop, which can be set to an object mapping field `name` attributes to error messages. This is useful to display validation errors that come from the server. The fields receive these messages from the form via context. After the user modifies the value in the field, the server validation errors for that field are cleared until the `validationErrors` prop changes (i.e. after the next submit).

## Implementation

Currently this is implemented in the hooks and in React Spectrum. It will come to React Aria Components in a followup PR. The implementation consists of two parts:

* `useFormValidationState` in `@react-stately/form`, and used by all of our stately hooks. This tracks both the realtime validation state and validation state currently displayed to the user, and combines all of the errors from all of the above sources together. It includes methods to update and commit the validation state when the user changes the value.
* `useFormValidation` in `@react-aria/form`, used by all of our aria hooks. This synchronizes the validation state with the native input element, and triggers state updates when various browser events occur.

## Test instructions

See the "Native validation" and "Server validation" stories that have been added under "Form" for the new behavior, and smoke test other form/component stories.

### @react-aria/checkbox

#### CheckboxAria
```diff
 CheckboxAria {
   inputProps: InputHTMLAttributes<HTMLInputElement>
   isDisabled: boolean
-  isInvalid: boolean
   isPressed: boolean
   isReadOnly: boolean
   isSelected: boolean
 }
```
it changed:
 - useCheckbox


-----------------------------------


### @react-aria/interactions

#### InteractOutsideProps
```diff
 InteractOutsideProps {
   isDisabled?: boolean
-  onInteractOutside?: (SyntheticEvent) => void
-  onInteractOutsideStart?: (SyntheticEvent) => void
+  onInteractOutside?: (PointerEvent) => void
+  onInteractOutsideStart?: (PointerEvent) => void
   ref: RefObject<Element>
 }
```
it changed:
 - useInteractOutside


-----------------------------------


### @react-aria/tag

#### AriaTagGroupProps
```diff
 AriaTagGroupProps<T> {
+  errorMessage?: ReactNode
   onRemove?: (Set<Key>) => void
   selectionBehavior?: SelectionBehavior
 }
```

-----------------------------------


### @react-aria/utils

#### isVirtualPointerEvent
```diff
-useEffectEvent {
-  fn: any
-  returnVal: undefined
-}
+
```


#### useFormReset
```diff
-
+useEffectEvent<T extends Function> {
+  fn: T
+  returnVal: undefined
+}
```

-----------------------------------


### @react-spectrum/form

#### Form
```diff
 SpectrumFormProps {
   action?: string
   children: ReactElement<SpectrumLabelableProps> | Array<ReactElement<SpectrumLabelableProps>>
   encType?: 'application/x-www-form-urlencoded' | 'multipart/form-data' | 'text/plain'
   isDisabled?: boolean
   isEmphasized?: boolean
   isQuiet?: boolean
   isReadOnly?: boolean
   isRequired?: boolean
   method?: 'get' | 'post'
   onSubmit?: FormEventHandler
   target?: '_blank' | '_self' | '_parent' | '_top'
+  validationBehavior?: 'aria' | 'native' = 'aria'
+  validationErrors?: ValidationErrors
   validationState?: ValidationState = 'valid'
 }
```

-----------------------------------


### @react-spectrum/label

#### Field
```diff
 HelpText {
   descriptionProps?: HTMLAttributes<HTMLElement>
+  errorMessage?: ReactNode
   errorMessageProps?: HTMLAttributes<HTMLElement>
 }
```

-----------------------------------


### @react-stately/checkbox

#### CheckboxGroupState
```diff
 CheckboxGroupState {
   addValue: (string) => void
   isDisabled: boolean
   isInvalid: boolean
   isReadOnly: boolean
+  isRequired: boolean
   isSelected: (string) => boolean
   removeValue: (string) => void
+  setInvalid: (string, ValidationResult) => void
   setValue: (Array<string>) => void
   toggleValue: (string) => void
   value: readonly Array<string>
 }
```
it changed:
 - useCheckboxGroupState


-----------------------------------


### @react-stately/radio

#### RadioGroupState
```diff
 RadioGroupState {
   isDisabled: boolean
   isInvalid: boolean
   isReadOnly: boolean
   isRequired: boolean
   lastFocusedValue: string | null
-  selectedValue: string | null | undefined
+  selectedValue: string | null
   setLastFocusedValue: (string) => void
   setSelectedValue: (string) => void
 }
```
it changed:
 - useRadioGroupState


-----------------------------------


### @react-aria/form

#### useFormValidation
```diff
-
+useFormValidation<T> {
+  props: Validation<T>
+  state: FormValidationState
+  ref: RefObject<ValidatableElement>
+  returnVal: undefined
+}
```

-----------------------------------


### @react-stately/form

#### FormValidationContext
```diff
-
+useFormValidationState<T> {
+  props: FormValidationProps<T>
+  returnVal: undefined
+}
```


#### useFormValidationState
```diff
-
+DEFAULT_VALIDATION_RESULT {
+  isInvalid: any
+  validationDetails: VALID_VALIDITY_STATE
+  validationErrors: any
+}
```


#### DEFAULT_VALIDATION_RESULT
changed by:
 - VALID_VALIDITY_STATE

```diff
-
+VALID_VALIDITY_STATE {
+  badInput: any
+  customError: any
+  patternMismatch: any
+  rangeOverflow: any
+  rangeUnderflow: any
+  stepMismatch: any
+  tooLong: any
+  tooShort: any
+  typeMismatch: any
+  valid: any
+  valueMissing: any
+}
```


#### VALID_VALIDITY_STATE
```diff
-
+mergeValidation {
+  results: Array<ValidationResult>
+  returnVal: undefined
+}
```
it changed:
 - DEFAULT_VALIDATION_RESULT



#### privateValidationStateProp
```diff
-
+FormValidationState {
+  commitValidation: () => void
+  displayValidation: ValidationResult
+  realtimeValidation: ValidationResult
+  resetValidation: () => void
+  updateValidation: (ValidationResult) => void
+}
```

-----------------------------------

issue.title: Support native form validation
issue.body:
Supersedes #4640

This implements support for native HTML form validation across all of our form components. It adds the following APIs:

* The `validationBehavior` prop can be set to `"aria"` (the default) or `"native"`. When set to `"native"`, we use the native `required` attribute rather than `aria-required` so that form submission is blocked by the browser. In addition, we track other native validation messages such as `pattern` or `type="email"` and display all validation errors as Spectrum help text rather than the browser's builtin UI.
* The `validate` prop can be set to a function to perform custom validation. This receives the current value of the field and can return an error message (or multiple) if it is invalid. This is displayed immediately (in realtime) if `validationBehavior="aria"`, or after the field value is committed (e.g. blurred) when `validationBehavior="native"`. This is in addition to our existing `isInvalid` and `errorMessage` props which are always displayed in realtime.

* The `Form` component accepts a `validationErrors` prop, which can be set to an object mapping field `name` attributes to error messages. This is useful to display validation errors that come from the server. The fields receive these messages from the form via context. After the user modifies the value in the field, the server validation errors for that field are cleared until the `validationErrors` prop changes (i.e. after the next submit).

Currently this is implemented in the hooks and in React Spectrum. It will come to React Aria Components in a followup PR. The implementation consists of two parts:

* `useFormValidationState` in `@react-stately/form`, and used by all of our stately hooks. Currently this is implemented in the hooks and in React Spectrum. It will come to React Aria Components in a followup PR. The implementation consists of two parts:

* `useFormValidationState` in `@react-stately/form`, and used by all of our stately hooks. This tracks both the realtime validation state and validation state currently displayed to the user, and combines all of the errors from all of the above sources together. It includes methods to update and commit the validation state when the user changes the value.
* `useFormValidation` in `@react-aria/form`, used by all of our aria hooks. This synchronizes the validation state with the native input element, and triggers state updates when various browser events occur.

## Test instructions

See the "Native validation" and "Server validation" stories that have been added under "Form" for the new behavior, and smoke test other form/component stories.

issue.title: Support native form validation
issue.body:
Supersedes #4640

This implements support for native HTML form validation across all of our form components. It adds the following APIs:

* The `validationBehavior` prop can be set to `"aria"` (the default) or `"native"`. When set to `"native"`, we use the native `required` attribute rather than `aria-required` so that form submission is blocked by the browser. In addition, we track other native validation messages such as `pattern` or `type="email"` and display all validation errors as Spectrum help text rather than the browser's builtin UI.
* The `validate` prop can be set to a function to perform custom validation. This receives the current value of the field and can return an error message (or multiple) if it is invalid. This is displayed immediately (in realtime) if `validationBehavior="aria"`, or after the field value is committed (e.g. blurred) when `validationBehavior="native"`. This is in addition to our existing `isInvalid` and `errorMessage` props which are always displayed in realtime.
* The `errorMessage` prop now accepts a function in addition to a string. The function receives the current validation details for the field and returns the validation error to display. This allows customizing native validation messages provided by the browser.
* The `Form` component accepts a `validationErrors` prop, which can be set to an object mapping field `name` attributes to error messages. This is useful to display validation errors that come from the server. The fields receive these messages from the form via context. After the user modifies the value in the field, the server validation errors for that field are cleared until the `validationErrors` prop changes (i.e. after the next submit).

## Implementation

Currently this is implemented in the hooks and in React Spectrum. It will come to React Aria Components in a followup PR. The implementation consists of two parts:

* `useFormValidationState` in `@react-stately/form`, and used by all of our stately hooks. This tracks both the realtime validation state and validation state currently displayed to the user, and combines all of the errors from all of the above sources together. It includes methods to update and commit the validation state when the user changes the value.
* `useFormValidation` in `@react-aria/form`, used by all of our aria hooks. This synchronizes the validation state with the native input element, and triggers state updates when various browser events occur.

## Test instructions

See the "Native validation" and "Server validation" stories that have been added under "Form" for the new behavior, and smoke test other form/component stories.

issue.title: Multiple empty :is() selectors in generated CSS
issue.body:
### Provide a general summary of the issue here

After creating an empty `react-ts` project with `vite`, installing the latest @adobe/react-spectrum in it, and changing `App.tsx` to this:

```js
import { Button } from '@adobe/react-spectrum'

function App() {
  return <Button variant="accent">Save</Button>;
}

export default App
```

after a production build we get CSS with several empty `:is()` and `:-webkit-any()` selectors like these:

```css
:is() .uFrYBa_spectrum-BarLoader-percentage{
    color:var(--spectrum-barloader-large-over-background-track-fill-color,var(--spectrum-global-color-static-white))
}
:-webkit-any() .uFrYBa_spectrum-BarLoader-track{
    background-color:var(--spectrum-barloader-large-over-background-track-color,var(--spectrum-alias-track-color-over-background))
}
```
Same issue with create-react-app, in fact these are already present in the files distributed in react-spectrum packages, e.g., `@react-spectrum/button/dist/main.css`

### 🤔 Expected Behavior?

No such empty rules are emitted/present.

### 😯 Current Behavior

Rules like that are created which probably cannot match any elements.

### 💁 Possible Solution

_No response_

### 🔦 Context

_No response_

### 🖥️ Steps to Reproduce

https://codesandbox.io/p/sandbox/wonderful-diffie-w8pfwl

### Version

3.31.1

### What browsers are you seeing the problem on?

Firefox, Chrome, Safari, Microsoft Edge

### If other, please specify.

_No response_

### What operating system are you using?

Linux

### 🧢 Your Company/Team

_No response_

### 🕷 Tracking Issue

_No response_

comment.body: Looks to have appeared starting with our last release (see https://unpkg.com/@react-spectrum/button@3.14.1/dist/main.css vs https://unpkg.com/@react-spectrum/button@3.13.0/dist/main.css). Looks to be due to [this PR](https://github.com/adobe/react-spectrum/pull/5093), the [nightly](https://unpkg.com/@react-spectrum/button@3.0.0-nightly.2444/dist/main.css) before this PR doesn't have this `:is()` selectors while this nightly [does](https://unpkg.com/@react-spectrum/button@3.0.0-nightly.2448/dist/main.css).

issue.title: Add validation support for React Aria Components
issue.body:
Depends on #5288

This adds support for the validation behaviors described in #5288 to React Aria Components. It includes two new components:

* `<FieldError>` renders form validation errors. It accepts render props to allow customization of the error messages.
* `<Form>` is a small wrapper around an HTML `<form>` that also supports the `validationErrors` prop for server errors, which is provided via the `FormValidationContext`. We could also potentially add more functionality here in the future (e.g. auto focusing the first invalid field).

In addition, in RAC `validationBehavior="native"` is the default rather than `validationBehavior="aria"`. I think this is a better default, but we cannot change the behavior in RSP for backward compatibility reasons.

```diff
   isSelected: (string) => boolean
   removeValue: (string) => void
+  setInvalid: (string, ValidationResult) => void
   setValue: (Array<string>) => void
   toggleValue: (string) => void
   value: readonly Array<string>
 }
```

issue.title: Add validation support for React Aria Components
issue.body:
Depends on #5288

This adds support for the validation behaviors described in #5288 to React Aria Components. It includes two new components:

* `<FieldError>` renders form validation errors. It accepts render props to allow customization of the error messages.
* `<Form>` is a small wrapper around an HTML `<form>` that also supports the `validationErrors` prop for server errors, which is provided via the `FormValidationContext`. We could also potentially add more functionality here in the future (e.g. auto focusing the first invalid field).

In addition, in RAC `validationBehavior="native"` is the default rather than `validationBehavior="aria"`. I think this is a better default, but we cannot change the behavior in RSP for backward compatibility reasons.
